00005 /*
00006  *      Author:          Bob Dalesio
00007  *      Date:            4-4-88
00008  *
00009  *      Experimental Physics and Industrial Control System (EPICS)
00010  *
00011  *      Copyright 1991, the Regents of the University of California,
00012  *      and the University of Chicago Board of Governors.
00013  *
00014  *      This software was produced under  U.S. Government contracts:
00015  *      (W-7405-ENG-36) at the Los Alamos National Laboratory,
00016  *      and (W-31-109-ENG-38) at Argonne National Laboratory.
00017  *
00018  *      Initial development by:
00019  *              The Controls and Automation Group (AT-8)
00020  *              Ground Test Accelerator
00021  *              Accelerator Technology Division
00022  *              Los Alamos National Laboratory
00023  *
00024  *      Co-developed with
00025  *              The Controls and Computing Group
00026  *              Accelerator Systems Division
00027  *              Advanced Photon Source
00028  *              Argonne National Laboratory
00029  *
00030  *
00031  *      Modification Log:
00032  *      -----------------
00033  * .01  05-02-88        lrd     add control enumeration field, structure & size
00034  * .02  05-12-88        lrd     add array structures
00035  *                              change structure names dbf_ to dbr_
00036  *                              add VALID_FIELD_TYPE & INVALID_FIELD_TYPE macros
00037  *                              add db_access_val union of all access strucures
00038  *                              add MAX_STRING_SIZE 40 define
00039  * .03  08-08-88        lrd     add no_elements to db_addr
00040  *                              removed DBF_ARRAY and all DBR_ARRAY variations
00041  *                              made value the last field of each structure
00042  *                              db_access_val union modified for changes
00043  *                              dbr_size array modified for changes
00044  * .04  11-29-88        lrd     fixed declaration of union db_access_val
00045  * .05  12-17-88        lrd     added extra processing field
00046  * .06  01-13-89        lrd     added EP_CALC for modifying calculations on-line
00047  * .07  03-12-90        joh     added INCLdb_accessh for auto include 
00048  * .08  04-06-90        lrd     add DBF_CHAR, DBF_LONG, DBF_DOUBLE
00049  *                              and DBR_TIME
00050  * .09  04-06-90        joh     added dbr_size_n(type, count)
00051  * .10  04-06-90        joh     changed all dbr_size stuff to unsigned
00052  * .11  04-27-90        rac     added date to DBR_TIME structures
00053  * .12  05-02-90        rac     changed back to old way of doing sts and gr;
00054  *                              added dbr and dbf keywords and macros
00055  * .13  08-07-90        rac     re-enter various changes since .12; change
00056  *                              some char structure members to short; change
00057  *                              time structures once more.
00058  * .14  10-29-90        joh     forced size and value size to allocate in
00059  *                              one module alone. 
00060  * .15  10-29-90        joh     added the readonly keyword for VAX C after 
00061  *                              failing to find any way to get the CA VMS share 
00062  *                              image to work without polluting the source.
00063  * .16  01-07-91        rac     fix a problem with dbf_text_to_type()
00064  * .17  06-03-91        joh     SPARC padding. 
00065  * .18  06-04-91        joh     added VALID_DB_FIELD(x) & INVALID_DB_FIELD(x)
00066  *                              macros.
00067  * .19  03-01-91        mda     integration of ANL/LANL code
00068  * .20  06-25-91        joh     added #include db_addr.h
00069  * .21  02-02-94        mrk     added PUTNOTIFY
00070  * .22  08-17-94        joh     MAX_UNITS_SIZE, MAX_ENUM_STRING_SIZE,
00071  *                              MAX_ENUM_STATES used to declare the
00072  *                              character arrays.
00073  * .23  08-17-94        joh     dbr_value_class[] definitions,
00074  * .24  08-17-94        joh     arch independent types
00075  * .25  03-06-95        joh     more arch independent types     
00076  * .26  05-17-95        joh     conversion between epics core types
00077  *                              and dbr types
00078  * .27  05-26-95        joh     added const     
00079  * .28  10-10-96        joh     eliminated the dbAddr/db_addr mess
00080  *
00081  * NOTES:
00082  * .01  06-04-91        joh     the value must always be the last item 
00083  *                              in the structure so arrays work.
00084  * .02  06-05-91        joh     structures are aligned to their largest memeber
00085  *                              for the SPARC. CA takes care of alignment
00086  *                              between structures as part of the CA protocol.
00087  */
00088

00104 #define MAX_UNITS_SIZE          8
00105 #define MAX_ENUM_STRING_SIZE    26
00106 #define MAX_ENUM_STATES         16

00108 /*
00109  * architecture independent types
00110  *
00111  * (so far this is sufficient for all archs we have ported to)
00112  */
00113    typedef epicsOldString dbr_string_t;
00114    typedef epicsUInt8 dbr_char_t;
00115    typedef epicsInt16 dbr_short_t;
00116    typedef epicsUInt16 dbr_ushort_t;
00117    typedef epicsInt16 dbr_int_t;
00118    typedef epicsUInt16 dbr_enum_t;
00119    typedef epicsInt32 dbr_long_t;
00120    typedef epicsUInt32 dbr_ulong_t;
00121    typedef epicsFloat32 dbr_float_t;
00122    typedef epicsFloat64 dbr_double_t;
00123    typedef epicsUInt16 dbr_put_ackt_t;
00124    typedef epicsUInt16 dbr_put_acks_t;
00125 
00126 /* database field types */
00127 #define DBF_STRING      0
00128 #define DBF_INT         1
00129 #define DBF_SHORT       1
00130 #define DBF_FLOAT       2
00131 #define DBF_ENUM        3
00132 #define DBF_CHAR        4
00133 #define DBF_LONG        5
00134 #define DBF_DOUBLE      6
00135 #define DBF_NO_ACCESS   7
00136 #define LAST_TYPE       DBF_DOUBLE
00137 #define VALID_DB_FIELD(x)       ((x >= 0) && (x <= LAST_TYPE))
00138 #define INVALID_DB_FIELD(x)     ((x < 0) || (x > LAST_TYPE))
00139 
00140 /* data request buffer types */
00141 #define DBR_STRING      DBF_STRING
00142 #define DBR_INT         DBF_INT
00143 #define DBR_SHORT       DBF_INT
00144 #define DBR_FLOAT       DBF_FLOAT
00145 #define DBR_ENUM        DBF_ENUM
00146 #define DBR_CHAR        DBF_CHAR
00147 #define DBR_LONG        DBF_LONG
00148 #define DBR_DOUBLE      DBF_DOUBLE
00149 #define DBR_STS_STRING  7
00150 #define DBR_STS_SHORT   8
00151 #define DBR_STS_INT     DBR_STS_SHORT
00152 #define DBR_STS_FLOAT   9
00153 #define DBR_STS_ENUM    10
00154 #define DBR_STS_CHAR    11
00155 #define DBR_STS_LONG    12
00156 #define DBR_STS_DOUBLE  13
00157 #define DBR_TIME_STRING 14
00158 #define DBR_TIME_INT    15
00159 #define DBR_TIME_SHORT  15
00160 #define DBR_TIME_FLOAT  16
00161 #define DBR_TIME_ENUM   17
00162 #define DBR_TIME_CHAR   18
00163 #define DBR_TIME_LONG   19
00164 #define DBR_TIME_DOUBLE 20
00165 #define DBR_GR_STRING   21
00166 #define DBR_GR_SHORT    22
00167 #define DBR_GR_INT      DBR_GR_SHORT
00168 #define DBR_GR_FLOAT    23
00169 #define DBR_GR_ENUM     24
00170 #define DBR_GR_CHAR     25
00171 #define DBR_GR_LONG     26
00172 #define DBR_GR_DOUBLE   27
00173 #define DBR_CTRL_STRING 28
00174 #define DBR_CTRL_SHORT  29
00175 #define DBR_CTRL_INT    DBR_CTRL_SHORT
00176 #define DBR_CTRL_FLOAT  30
00177 #define DBR_CTRL_ENUM   31
00178 #define DBR_CTRL_CHAR   32
00179 #define DBR_CTRL_LONG   33
00180 #define DBR_CTRL_DOUBLE 34
00181 #define DBR_PUT_ACKT    DBR_CTRL_DOUBLE + 1
00182 #define DBR_PUT_ACKS    DBR_PUT_ACKT + 1
00183 #define DBR_STSACK_STRING DBR_PUT_ACKS + 1
00184 #define DBR_CLASS_NAME DBR_STSACK_STRING + 1
00185 #define LAST_BUFFER_TYPE        DBR_CLASS_NAME
00186 #define VALID_DB_REQ(x) ((x >= 0) && (x <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE))
00187 #define INVALID_DB_REQ(x)       ((x < 0) || (x > LAST_BUFFER_TYPE))
00188 
00189 /*
00190  * The enumeration "epicsType" is an index to this array
00191  * of type DBR types. In some cases we select the a
00192  * larger type to avoid loss of information
00193  */
00194 #ifdef DB_TEXT_GLBLSOURCE
00195    epicsShareDef READONLY int epicsTypeToDBR_XXXX[lastEpicsType + 1] = {
00196       DBR_SHORT,                /* forces conversion fronm uint8 to int16 */
00197       DBR_CHAR,
00198       DBR_SHORT,
00199       DBR_LONG,                 /* forces conversion fronm uint16 to int32 */
00200       DBR_ENUM,
00201       DBR_LONG,
00202       DBR_LONG,                 /* very large unsigned number will not map */
00203       DBR_FLOAT,
00204       DBR_DOUBLE,
00205       DBR_STRING,
00206       DBR_STRING
00207    };
00208 #else
00209    epicsShareExtern READONLY int epicsTypeToDBR_XXXX[lastEpicsType + 1];
00210 #endif
00211 
00212 /*Definitions that allow old database access to use new conversion routines*/
00213 #define newDBF_DEVICE 11
00214 #define newDBR_ENUM    9
00215 #ifdef __STDC__
00216    void *dbCalloc(size_t nobj, size_t size);
00217    void *dbMalloc(size_t size);
00218    extern long (*dbGetConvertRoutine[newDBF_DEVICE + 1][newDBR_ENUM + 1])
00219     (struct dbAddr * paddr, void *pbuffer, long nRequest, long no_elements, long offset);
00220    extern long (*dbPutConvertRoutine[newDBR_ENUM + 1][newDBF_DEVICE + 1])
00221     (struct dbAddr * paddr, void *pbuffer, long nRequest, long no_elements, long offset);
00222    extern long (*dbFastGetConvertRoutine[newDBF_DEVICE + 1][newDBR_ENUM + 1]) ();
00223    extern long (*dbFastPutConvertRoutine[newDBR_ENUM + 1][newDBF_DEVICE + 1]) ();
00224 #else
00225    extern long (*dbGetConvertRoutine[newDBF_DEVICE + 1][newDBR_ENUM + 1]) ();
00226    extern long (*dbPutConvertRoutine[newDBR_ENUM + 1][newDBF_DEVICE + 1]) ();
00227    extern long (*dbFastGetConvertRoutine[newDBF_DEVICE + 1][newDBR_ENUM + 1]) ();
00228    extern long (*dbFastPutConvertRoutine[newDBR_ENUM + 1][newDBF_DEVICE + 1]) ();
00229    void *dbCalloc();
00230    void *dbMalloc();
00231 #endif /*__STDC__*/

00233 /*Conversion between old and new DBR types*/
00234    extern unsigned short dbDBRoldToDBFnew[DBR_DOUBLE + 1];
00235    extern unsigned short dbDBRnewToDBRold[newDBR_ENUM + 1];
00236 #ifdef DB_TEXT_GLBLSOURCE
00237    unsigned short dbDBRoldToDBFnew[DBR_DOUBLE + 1] = {
00238       0,                        /*DBR_STRING to DBF_STRING */
00239       3,                        /*DBR_INT to DBF_SHORT */
00240       7,                        /*DBR_FLOAT to DBF_FLOAT */
00241       9,                        /*DBR_ENUM to DBF_ENUM */
00242       1,                        /*DBR_CHAR to DBF_CHAR */
00243       5,                        /*DBR_LONG to DBF_LONG */
00244       8                         /*DBR_DOUBLE to DBF_DOUBLE */
00245    };
00246    unsigned short dbDBRnewToDBRold[newDBR_ENUM + 1] = {
00247       0,                        /*DBR_STRING to DBR_STRING */
00248       4,                        /*DBR_CHAR to DBR_CHAR */
00249       4,                        /*DBR_UCHAR to DBR_CHAR */
00250       1,                        /*DBR_SHORT to DBR_SHORT */
00251       5,                        /*DBR_USHORT to DBR_LONG */
00252       5,                        /*DBR_LONG to DBR_LONG */
00253       6,                        /*DBR_ULONG to DBR_DOUBLE */
00254       2,                        /*DBR_FLOAT to DBR_FLOAT */
00255       6,                        /*DBR_DOUBLE to DBR_DOUBLE */
00256       3,                        /*DBR_ENUM to DBR_ENUM */
00257    };
00258 #endif                          /*DB_TEXT_GLBLSOURCE */
00259

00314 /* extra processing flags */
00315 #define EP_SCAN 0x01
00316 #define EP_INIT 0x02
00317 #define EP_CALC 0x03
00318 
00319 /* values returned for each field type
00320  *      DBR_STRING      returns a NULL terminated string
00321  *      DBR_SHORT       returns an unsigned short
00322  *      DBR_INT         returns an unsigned short
00323  *      DBR_FLOAT       returns an IEEE floating point value
00324  *      DBR_ENUM        returns an unsigned short which is the enum item
00325  *      DBR_CHAR        returns an unsigned char
00326  *      DBR_LONG        returns an unsigned long
00327  *      DBR_DOUBLE      returns a double precision floating point number
00328  *      DBR_STS_STRING  returns a string status structure (dbr_sts_string)
00329  *      DBR_STS_SHORT   returns a short status structure (dbr_sts_short)
00330  *      DBR_STS_INT     returns a short status structure (dbr_sts_int)
00331  *      DBR_STS_FLOAT   returns a float status structure (dbr_sts_float)
00332  *      DBR_STS_ENUM    returns an enum status structure (dbr_sts_enum)
00333  *      DBR_STS_CHAR    returns a char status structure (dbr_sts_char)
00334  *      DBR_STS_LONG    returns a long status structure (dbr_sts_long)
00335  *      DBR_STS_DOUBLE  returns a double status structure (dbr_sts_double)
00336  *      DBR_TIME_STRING returns a string time structure (dbr_time_string)
00337  *      DBR_TIME_SHORT  returns a short time structure (dbr_time_short)
00338  *      DBR_TIME_INT    returns a short time structure (dbr_time_short)
00339  *      DBR_TIME_FLOAT  returns a float time structure (dbr_time_float)
00340  *      DBR_TIME_ENUM   returns an enum time structure (dbr_time_enum)
00341  *      DBR_TIME_CHAR   returns a char time structure (dbr_time_char)
00342  *      DBR_TIME_LONG   returns a long time structure (dbr_time_long)
00343  *      DBR_TIME_DOUBLE returns a double time structure (dbr_time_double)
00344  *      DBR_GR_STRING   returns a graphic string structure (dbr_gr_string)
00345  *      DBR_GR_SHORT    returns a graphic short structure (dbr_gr_short)
00346  *      DBR_GR_INT      returns a graphic short structure (dbr_gr_int)
00347  *      DBR_GR_FLOAT    returns a graphic float structure (dbr_gr_float)
00348  *      DBR_GR_ENUM     returns a graphic enum structure (dbr_gr_enum)
00349  *      DBR_GR_CHAR     returns a graphic char structure (dbr_gr_char)
00350  *      DBR_GR_LONG     returns a graphic long structure (dbr_gr_long)
00351  *      DBR_GR_DOUBLE   returns a graphic double structure (dbr_gr_double)
00352  *      DBR_CTRL_STRING returns a control string structure (dbr_ctrl_int)
00353  *      DBR_CTRL_SHORT  returns a control short structure (dbr_ctrl_short)
00354  *      DBR_CTRL_INT    returns a control short structure (dbr_ctrl_int)
00355  *      DBR_CTRL_FLOAT  returns a control float structure (dbr_ctrl_float)
00356  *      DBR_CTRL_ENUM   returns a control enum structure (dbr_ctrl_enum)
00357  *      DBR_CTRL_CHAR   returns a control char structure (dbr_ctrl_char)
00358  *      DBR_CTRL_LONG   returns a control long structure (dbr_ctrl_long)
00359  *      DBR_CTRL_DOUBLE returns a control double structure (dbr_ctrl_double)
00360  */
00361 
00362 
00363 /* VALUES WITH STATUS STRUCTURES */
00364 
00365 /* structure for a  string status field */
00366    struct dbr_sts_string {
00367       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00368       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00369       dbr_string_t value;       /* current value */
00370    };
00371 
00372 /* structure for a  string status and ack field */
00373    struct dbr_stsack_string {
00374       dbr_ushort_t status;      /* status of value */
00375       dbr_ushort_t severity;    /* severity of alarm */
00376       dbr_ushort_t ackt;        /* ack transient? */
00377       dbr_ushort_t acks;        /* ack severity */
00378       dbr_string_t value;       /* current value */
00379    };
00380 /* structure for an short status field */
00381    struct dbr_sts_int {
00382       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00383       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00384       dbr_short_t value;        /* current value */
00385    };
00386    struct dbr_sts_short {
00387       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00388       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00389       dbr_short_t value;        /* current value */
00390    };
00391 
00392 /* structure for a  float status field */
00393    struct dbr_sts_float {
00394       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00395       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00396       dbr_float_t value;        /* current value */
00397    };
00398 
00399 /* structure for a  enum status field */
00400    struct dbr_sts_enum {
00401       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00402       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00403       dbr_enum_t value;         /* current value */
00404    };
00405 
00406 /* structure for a char status field */
00407    struct dbr_sts_char {
00408       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00409       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00410       dbr_char_t RISC_pad;      /* RISC alignment */
00411       dbr_char_t value;         /* current value */
00412    };
00413 
00414 /* structure for a long status field */
00415    struct dbr_sts_long {
00416       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00417       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00418       dbr_long_t value;         /* current value */
00419    };
00420 
00421 /* structure for a double status field */
00422    struct dbr_sts_double {
00423       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00424       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00425       dbr_long_t RISC_pad;      /* RISC alignment */
00426       dbr_double_t value;       /* current value */
00427    };
00428 
00429 /* VALUES WITH STATUS AND TIME STRUCTURES */
00430 
00431 /* structure for a  string time field */
00432    struct dbr_time_string {
00433       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00434       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00435       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00436       dbr_string_t value;       /* current value */
00437    };
00438 
00439 /* structure for an short time field */
00440    struct dbr_time_short {
00441       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00442       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00443       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00444       dbr_short_t RISC_pad;     /* RISC alignment */
00445       dbr_short_t value;        /* current value */
00446    };
00447 
00448 /* structure for a  float time field */
00449    struct dbr_time_float {
00450       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00451       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00452       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00453       dbr_float_t value;        /* current value */
00454    };
00455 
00456 /* structure for a  enum time field */
00457    struct dbr_time_enum {
00458       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00459       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00460       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00461       dbr_short_t RISC_pad;     /* RISC alignment */
00462       dbr_enum_t value;         /* current value */
00463    };
00464 
00465 /* structure for a char time field */
00466    struct dbr_time_char {
00467       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00468       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00469       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00470       dbr_short_t RISC_pad0;    /* RISC alignment */
00471       dbr_char_t RISC_pad1;     /* RISC alignment */
00472       dbr_char_t value;         /* current value */
00473    };
00474 
00475 /* structure for a long time field */
00476    struct dbr_time_long {
00477       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00478       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00479       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00480       dbr_long_t value;         /* current value */
00481    };
00482 
00483 /* structure for a double time field */
00484    struct dbr_time_double {
00485       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00486       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00487       TS_STAMP stamp;           /* time stamp */
00488       dbr_long_t RISC_pad;      /* RISC alignment */
00489       dbr_double_t value;       /* current value */
00490    };

00492 /* VALUES WITH STATUS AND GRAPHIC STRUCTURES */
00493 
00494 /* structure for a graphic string */
00495    /* not implemented; use struct_dbr_sts_string */
00496 
00497 /* structure for a graphic short field */
00498    struct dbr_gr_int {
00499       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00500       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00501       char units[MAX_UNITS_SIZE];       /* units of value */
00502       dbr_short_t upper_disp_limit;     /* upper limit of graph */
00503       dbr_short_t lower_disp_limit;     /* lower limit of graph */
00504       dbr_short_t upper_alarm_limit;
00505       dbr_short_t upper_warning_limit;
00506       dbr_short_t lower_warning_limit;
00507       dbr_short_t lower_alarm_limit;
00508       dbr_short_t value;        /* current value */
00509    };
00510    struct dbr_gr_short {
00511       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00512       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00513       char units[MAX_UNITS_SIZE];       /* units of value */
00514       dbr_short_t upper_disp_limit;     /* upper limit of graph */
00515       dbr_short_t lower_disp_limit;     /* lower limit of graph */
00516       dbr_short_t upper_alarm_limit;
00517       dbr_short_t upper_warning_limit;
00518       dbr_short_t lower_warning_limit;
00519       dbr_short_t lower_alarm_limit;
00520       dbr_short_t value;        /* current value */
00521    };
00522 
00523 /* structure for a graphic floating point field */
00524    struct dbr_gr_float {
00525       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00526       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00527       dbr_short_t precision;    /* number of decimal places */
00528       dbr_short_t RISC_pad0;    /* RISC alignment */
00529       char units[MAX_UNITS_SIZE];       /* units of value */
00530       dbr_float_t upper_disp_limit;     /* upper limit of graph */
00531       dbr_float_t lower_disp_limit;     /* lower limit of graph */
00532       dbr_float_t upper_alarm_limit;
00533       dbr_float_t upper_warning_limit;
00534       dbr_float_t lower_warning_limit;
00535       dbr_float_t lower_alarm_limit;
00536       dbr_float_t value;        /* current value */
00537    };
00538 
00539 /* structure for a graphic enumeration field */
00540    struct dbr_gr_enum {
00541       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00542       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00543       dbr_short_t no_str;       /* number of strings */
00544       char strs[MAX_ENUM_STATES][MAX_ENUM_STRING_SIZE];
00545       /* state strings */
00546       dbr_enum_t value;         /* current value */
00547    };
00548 
00549 /* structure for a graphic char field */
00550    struct dbr_gr_char {
00551       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00552       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00553       char units[MAX_UNITS_SIZE];       /* units of value */
00554       dbr_char_t upper_disp_limit;      /* upper limit of graph */
00555       dbr_char_t lower_disp_limit;      /* lower limit of graph */
00556       dbr_char_t upper_alarm_limit;
00557       dbr_char_t upper_warning_limit;
00558       dbr_char_t lower_warning_limit;
00559       dbr_char_t lower_alarm_limit;
00560       dbr_char_t RISC_pad;      /* RISC alignment */
00561       dbr_char_t value;         /* current value */
00562    };
00563 
00564 /* structure for a graphic long field */
00565    struct dbr_gr_long {
00566       dbr_short_t status;       /* status of value */
00567       dbr_short_t severity;     /* severity of alarm */
00568       char units[MAX_UNITS_SIZE];       /* units of value */
00569       dbr_long_t upper_disp_limit;      /* upper limit of graph */
00570       dbr_long_t lower_disp_limit;      /* lower limit of graph */
00571       dbr_long_t upper_alarm_limit;
00572       dbr_long_t upper_warning_limit;
00573       dbr_long_t lower_warning_limit;
00574       dbr_long_t lower_alarm_limit;
00575       dbr_long_t value;         /* current value */
00576    };

00592    };

00708 #define dbr_size_n(TYPE,COUNT)\
00709 ((unsigned)((COUNT)==1?dbr_size[TYPE]:dbr_size[TYPE]+((COUNT)-1)*dbr_value_size[TYPE]))
00710 /* size for each type */

00718       sizeof(dbr_float_t),      /* IEEE Float                   */
00719       sizeof(dbr_enum_t),       /* item number                  */
00720       sizeof(dbr_char_t),       /* character                    */
00721       sizeof(dbr_long_t),       /* long                         */
00722       sizeof(dbr_double_t),     /* double                       */
00723       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_string),    /* string field with status     */
00724       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_short),     /* short field with status      */
00725       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_float),     /* float field with status      */
00726       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_enum),      /* item number with status      */
00727       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_char),      /* char field with status       */
00728       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_long),      /* long field with status       */
00729       sizeof(struct dbr_sts_double),    /* double field with time       */

00863 
00864 /* 
00865  * ptr to value given a pointer to the structure and the DBR type
00866  */
00867 #define dbr_value_ptr(PDBR, DBR_TYPE) \
00868 ((void *)(((char *)PDBR)+dbr_value_offset[DBR_TYPE]))
00869 
00870 /* 
00871  * byte offset of member in structure
00872  */
00873 #define BYTE_OS(STRUCTURE, MEMBER) \
00874 ((int) & (((STRUCTURE *)0) -> MEMBER))
00875 
00876 /* 
00877  * ptr to value given a pointer to the structure and the structure declaration
00878  */
00879 #define dbr_value_ptr_from_structure(PDBR, STRUCTURE)\
00880 ((void *)(((char *)PDBR)+BYTE_OS(STRUCTURE, value)))
00881 
00882 #ifndef DB_TEXT_GLBLSOURCE
00883    epicsShareExtern READONLY unsigned short dbr_value_offset[LAST_BUFFER_TYPE + 1];
00884 #else
00885    epicsShareDef READONLY unsigned short dbr_value_offset[LAST_BUFFER_TYPE + 1] = {
00886       0,                        /* string                       */
00887       0,                        /* short                        */
00888       0,                        /* IEEE Float                   */
00889       0,                        /* item number                  */
00890       0,                        /* character                    */
00891       0,                        /* long                         */
00892       0,                        /* IEEE double                  */
00893       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_string, value[0]), /* string field with status     */
00894       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_short, value),     /* short field with status      */
00895       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_float, value),     /* float field with status      */
00896       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_enum, value),      /* item number with status      */
00897       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_char, value),      /* char field with status       */
00898       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_long, value),      /* long field with status       */
00899       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_double, value),    /* double field with time       */
00900       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_string, value[0]),        /* string field with time      */
00901       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_short, value),    /* short field with time        */
00902       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_float, value),    /* float field with time        */
00903       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_enum, value),     /* item number with time        */
00904       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_char, value),     /* char field with time         */
00905       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_long, value),     /* long field with time         */
00906       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_time_double, value),   /* double field with time       */
00907       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_string, value[0]), /* graphic string info          */
00908       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_gr_short, value),      /* graphic short info           */
00909       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_gr_float, value),      /* graphic float info           */
00910       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_gr_enum, value),       /* graphic item info            */
00911       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_gr_char, value),       /* graphic char info            */
00912       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_gr_long, value),       /* graphic long info            */
00913       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_gr_double, value),     /* graphic double info          */
00914       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_sts_string, value[0]), /* control string info          */
00915       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_ctrl_short, value),    /* control short info           */
00916       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_ctrl_float, value),    /* control float info           */
00917       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_ctrl_enum, value),     /* control item info            */
00918       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_ctrl_char, value),     /* control char info            */
00919       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_ctrl_long, value),     /* control long info            */
00920       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_ctrl_double, value),   /* control double info          */
00921       0,                        /* put ackt                     */
00922       0,                        /* put acks                     */
00923       BYTE_OS(struct dbr_stsack_string, value[0]),      /* string field      with status     */
00924       0,                        /* string                       */
00925    };
00926 #endif
00927 
00928 /* union for each fetch buffers */
00929    union db_access_val {
00930       dbr_string_t strval;      /* string max size            */
00931       dbr_short_t shrtval;      /* short                      */
00932       dbr_short_t intval;       /* short                      */
00933       dbr_float_t fltval;       /* IEEE Float                 */
00934       dbr_enum_t enmval;        /* item number                */
00935       dbr_char_t charval;       /* character                  */
00936       dbr_long_t longval;       /* long                       */
00937       dbr_double_t doubleval;   /* double                     */
00938       struct dbr_sts_string sstrval;    /* string field with status   */
00939       struct dbr_sts_short sshrtval;    /* short field with status    */
00940       struct dbr_sts_float sfltval;     /* float field with status    */
00941       struct dbr_sts_enum senmval;      /* item number with status    */
00942       struct dbr_sts_char schrval;      /* char field with status     */
00943       struct dbr_sts_long slngval;      /* long field with status     */
00944       struct dbr_sts_double sdblval;    /* double field with time     */
00945       struct dbr_time_string tstrval;   /* string field with time     */
00946       struct dbr_time_short tshrtval;   /* short field with time      */
00947       struct dbr_time_float tfltval;    /* float field with time      */
00948       struct dbr_time_enum tenmval;     /* item number with time      */
00949       struct dbr_time_char tchrval;     /* char field with time       */
00950       struct dbr_time_long tlngval;     /* long field with time       */
00951       struct dbr_time_double tdblval;   /* double field with time     */
00952       struct dbr_sts_string gstrval;    /* graphic string info        */
00953       struct dbr_gr_short gshrtval;     /* graphic short info         */
00954       struct dbr_gr_float gfltval;      /* graphic float info         */
00955       struct dbr_gr_enum genmval;       /* graphic item info          */
00956       struct dbr_gr_char gchrval;       /* graphic char info          */
00957       struct dbr_gr_long glngval;       /* graphic long info          */
00958       struct dbr_gr_double gdblval;     /* graphic double info        */
00959       struct dbr_sts_string cstrval;    /* control string info        */
00960       struct dbr_ctrl_short cshrtval;   /* control short info         */
00961       struct dbr_ctrl_float cfltval;    /* control float info         */
00962       struct dbr_ctrl_enum cenmval;     /* control item info          */
00963       struct dbr_ctrl_char cchrval;     /* control char info          */
00964       struct dbr_ctrl_long clngval;     /* control long info          */
00965       struct dbr_ctrl_double cdblval;   /* control double info        */
00966       dbr_put_ackt_t putackt;   /* item number                */
00967       dbr_put_acks_t putacks;   /* item number                */
00968       struct dbr_sts_string sastrval;   /* string field with status   */
00969       dbr_string_t classname;   /* string max size            */
00970    };
00971 
00972 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00973 * repository for some useful PV database constants and utilities
00974 *
00975 * item dimensions
00976 *    db_strval_dim              dimension for string values
00977 *    db_units_dim               dimension for record units text
00978 *    db_desc_dim                dimension for record description text
00979 *    db_name_dim                dimension for channel names (record.field\0)
00980 *    db_state_dim               number of states possible in a state table
00981 *    db_state_text_dim          dimension for a state text string
00982 *               usage: char state_table[db_state_dim][db_state_text_dim]
00983 *
00984 * type checking macros -- return non-zero if condition is true, zero otherwise
00985 *
00986 *      int dbf_type_is_valid(type)      type is a valid DBF_xxx
00987 *      int dbr_type_is_valid(type)      type is a valid DBR_xxx
00988 *      int dbr_type_is_plain(type)      type is a valid plain DBR_xxx
00989 *      int dbr_type_is_STS(type)        type is a valid DBR_STS_xxx
00990 *      int dbr_type_is_TIME(type)       type is a valid DBR_TIME_xxx
00991 *      int dbr_type_is_GR(type)         type is a valid DBR_GR_xxx
00992 *      int dbr_type_is_CTRL(type)       type is a valid DBR_CTRL_xxx
00993 *      int dbr_type_is_STRING(type)     type is a valid DBR_STRING_xxx
00994 *      int dbr_type_is_SHORT(type)      type is a valid DBR_SHORT_xxx
00995 *      int dbr_type_is_FLOAT(type)      type is a valid DBR_FLOAT_xxx
00996 *      int dbr_type_is_ENUM(type)       type is a valid DBR_ENUM_xxx
00997 *      int dbr_type_is_CHAR(type)       type is a valid DBR_CHAR_xxx
00998 *      int dbr_type_is_LONG(type)       type is a valid DBR_LONG_xxx
00999 *      int dbr_type_is_DOUBLE(type)     type is a valid DBR_DOUBLE_xxx
01000 *
01001 * type conversion macros
01002 *
01003 *    char *dbf_type_to_text(type)       returns text matching DBF_xxx
01004 *     void dbf_text_to_type(text, type) finds DBF_xxx matching text
01005 *      int dbf_type_to_DBR(type)        returns DBR_xxx matching DBF_xxx
01006 *      int dbf_type_to_DBR_TIME(type)   returns DBR_TIME_xxx matching DBF_xxx
01007 *      int dbf_type_to_DBR_GR(type)     returns DBR_GR_xxx matching DBF_xxx
01008 *      int dbf_type_to_DBR_CTRL(type)   returns DBR_CTRL_xxx matching DBF_xxx
01009 *    char *dbr_type_to_text(type)       returns text matching DBR_xxx
01010 *     void dbr_text_to_type(text, type) finds DBR_xxx matching text
01011 *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01012 #define db_strval_dim           MAX_STRING_SIZE
01013 #define db_units_dim            MAX_UNITS_SIZE
01014 #define db_desc_dim             24
01015 #define db_name_dim             36
01016 #define db_state_dim            MAX_ENUM_STATES
01017 #define db_state_text_dim       MAX_ENUM_STRING_SIZE
01018 
01019 #define dbf_type_is_valid(type)   ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_TYPE)
01020 #define dbr_type_is_valid(type)   ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE)
01021 #define dbr_type_is_plain(type)   \
01022                 ((type) >= DBR_STRING && (type) <= DBR_DOUBLE)
01023 #define dbr_type_is_STS(type)   \
01024                 ((type) >= DBR_STS_STRING && (type) <= DBR_STS_DOUBLE)
01025 #define dbr_type_is_TIME(type)   \
01026                 ((type) >= DBR_TIME_STRING && (type) <= DBR_TIME_DOUBLE)
01027 #define dbr_type_is_GR(type)   \
01028                 ((type) >= DBR_GR_STRING && (type) <= DBR_GR_DOUBLE)
01029 #define dbr_type_is_CTRL(type)   \
01030                 ((type) >= DBR_CTRL_STRING && (type) <= DBR_CTRL_DOUBLE)
01031 #define dbr_type_is_STRING(type)   \
01032                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01033                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_STRING)
01034 #define dbr_type_is_SHORT(type)   \
01035                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01036                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_SHORT)
01037 #define dbr_type_is_FLOAT(type)   \
01038                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01039                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_FLOAT)
01040 #define dbr_type_is_ENUM(type)   \
01041                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01042                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_ENUM)
01043 #define dbr_type_is_CHAR(type)   \
01044                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01045                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_CHAR)
01046 #define dbr_type_is_LONG(type)   \
01047                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01048                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_LONG)
01049 #define dbr_type_is_DOUBLE(type)   \
01050                 ((type) >= 0 && (type) <= LAST_BUFFER_TYPE && \
01051                  (type)%(LAST_TYPE+1) == DBR_DOUBLE)
01052 
01053 #define dbf_type_to_text(type)   \
01054     (  ((type) >= -1 && (type) <= dbf_text_dim-2) ? \
01055         dbf_text[(type+1)] : dbf_text_invalid  )
01056 
01057 #define dbf_text_to_type(text, type)   \
01058     for (type=dbf_text_dim-3; type>=0; type--) { \
01059         if (strcmp(text, dbf_text[type+1]) == 0) \
01060         break; \
01061     }
01062 
01063 #define dbr_type_to_text(type)   \
01064     (  ((type) >= 0 && (type) < dbr_text_dim) ? \
01065         dbr_text[(type)] : dbr_text_invalid  )
01066 
01067 #define dbr_text_to_type(text, type)   \
01068     for (type=dbr_text_dim-1; type>=0; type--) { \
01069         if (strcmp(text, dbr_text[type]) == 0) \
01070         break; \
01071     }
01072 
01073 #define dbf_type_to_DBR(type)   \
01074     (((type) >= 0 && (type) <= dbf_text_dim-3) ? \
01075         (type)   :  -1  )
01076 
01077 #define dbf_type_to_DBR_STS(type)  \
01078     (((type) >= 0 && (type) <= dbf_text_dim-3) ? \
01079         (type) + (dbf_text_dim-2)   :  -1  )
01080 
01081 #define dbf_type_to_DBR_TIME(type)  \
01082     (((type) >= 0 && (type) <= dbf_text_dim-3) ? \
01083         (type) + 2*(dbf_text_dim-2)   :  -1  )
01084 
01085 #define dbf_type_to_DBR_GR(type)  \
01086     (((type) >= 0 && (type) <= dbf_text_dim-3) ? \
01087         (type) + 3*(dbf_text_dim-2)   :  -1  )
01088 
01089 #define dbf_type_to_DBR_CTRL(type)  \
01090     (((type) >= 0 && (type) <= dbf_text_dim-3) ? \
01091         (type) + 4*(dbf_text_dim-2)   :  -1  )
01092 
01093 
01094 
01095 #ifndef DB_TEXT_GLBLSOURCE
01096    epicsShareExtern READONLY char *dbf_text[LAST_TYPE + 2], *dbf_text_invalid;
01097    epicsShareExtern READONLY short dbf_text_dim;
01098 #else
01099    epicsShareDef READONLY char *dbf_text[] = {
01100       "TYPENOTCONN",
01101       "DBF_STRING",
01102       "DBF_SHORT",
01103       "DBF_FLOAT",
01104       "DBF_ENUM",
01105       "DBF_CHAR",
01106       "DBF_LONG",
01107       "DBF_DOUBLE",
01108       "DBF_NO_ACCESS"
01109    };
01110    epicsShareDef READONLY char *dbf_text_invalid = "DBF_invalid";
01111    epicsShareDef READONLY short dbf_text_dim = (sizeof dbf_text) / (sizeof(char *));
01112 #endif
01113 
01114 #ifndef DB_TEXT_GLBLSOURCE
01115    epicsShareExtern READONLY char *dbr_text[LAST_BUFFER_TYPE + 1], *dbr_text_invalid;
01116    epicsShareExtern READONLY short dbr_text_dim;
01117 #else
01118    epicsShareDef READONLY char *dbr_text[LAST_BUFFER_TYPE + 1] = {
01119       "DBR_STRING",
01120       "DBR_SHORT",
01121       "DBR_FLOAT",
01122       "DBR_ENUM",
01123       "DBR_CHAR",
01124       "DBR_LONG",
01125       "DBR_DOUBLE",
01126       "DBR_STS_STRING",
01127       "DBR_STS_SHORT",
01128       "DBR_STS_FLOAT",
01129       "DBR_STS_ENUM",
01130       "DBR_STS_CHAR",
01131       "DBR_STS_LONG",
01132       "DBR_STS_DOUBLE",
01133       "DBR_TIME_STRING",
01134       "DBR_TIME_SHORT",
01135       "DBR_TIME_FLOAT",
01136       "DBR_TIME_ENUM",
01137       "DBR_TIME_CHAR",
01138       "DBR_TIME_LONG",
01139       "DBR_TIME_DOUBLE",
01140       "DBR_GR_STRING",
01141       "DBR_GR_SHORT",
01142       "DBR_GR_FLOAT",
01143       "DBR_GR_ENUM",
01144       "DBR_GR_CHAR",
01145       "DBR_GR_LONG",
01146       "DBR_GR_DOUBLE",
01147       "DBR_CTRL_STRING",
01148       "DBR_CTRL_SHORT",
01149       "DBR_CTRL_FLOAT",
01150       "DBR_CTRL_ENUM",
01151       "DBR_CTRL_CHAR",
01152       "DBR_CTRL_LONG",
01153       "DBR_CTRL_DOUBLE",

01156       "DBR_STSACK_STRING",
01157       "DBR_CLASS_NAME",
01158    };
01159    epicsShareDef READONLY char *dbr_text_invalid = "DBR_invalid";
01160    epicsShareDef READONLY short dbr_text_dim = (sizeof dbr_text) / (sizeof(char *)) + 1;
01161 #endif
